page.title: 02Wincobank Hill,Sheffield.
page.content: 2000 years ago, Wincobank Hill was used by the{Brigantes}as a{Hillfort,} but when the{Romans}started attacking them they used it as a{Signal Station. We went to the very top of Wincobank Hill and saw some remains of{ditches} the Brigantes dug. It was very windy. We could see nearly all round Sheffield. We saw three blocks of{ {flats}on the horizon that were like birthday candles. From a very ancient{Hillfort}we could see our modern city. There were tall blocks of flats and the Hallamshire Hospital, the M1 Motorway with Tinsley Viaduct. We could see the steel factories in the Don Valley. When World Championship Snooker is televised, Wincobank Hill is still a{ {Signal Station.}Television pictures are transmitted from the Crucible Theatre and relayed on to London.
